Utterance: Welcome back! How did your week go? Were you able to ask your dad about car repairs?
Yes! I did! He showed me a few things, and it was really interesting.
That’s fantastic! What did you learn?
I learned how to change the oil and check the tire pressure. It felt good to do something hands-on.
That’s a great accomplishment! How did you feel while you were learning?
I felt proud, like I was actually doing something useful.
That’s wonderful to hear! It seems like you’re building confidence in your skills. How has that affected your thoughts about the future?
I feel a bit less anxious about it. I think I can take it step by step.
That’s a healthy perspective! Have you had any moments of doubt since our last conversation?
A little, but I try to remind myself that it’s okay to learn at my own pace.
That’s a great coping strategy. It’s important to be patient with yourself. Have you had any other experiences with your dad that stood out?
Yeah, we talked a lot about his experiences in the business. It was nice to hear him share.
That’s valuable insight. How did that conversation make you feel about your relationship with him?
It made me feel closer to him. I appreciate him more now.
That’s beautiful! Building those connections can be so rewarding. Have you thought more about your girlfriend during this time?
Yeah, I think we’re doing really well. We’ve been more open with each other.
Open communication is key in relationships. Have you discussed your goals or aspirations with her?
I mentioned wanting to learn more at the shop, and she was really supportive.
That’s great! Having that support can make a big difference. Have you noticed any changes in how you handle stress or anxiety in your relationship?
I think I’m more open about how I feel, so that helps.
That’s a healthy approach. It’s important to express your feelings. Have you faced any challenges in your relationship lately?
Not really, just the usual stuff, but we handle it better now.
That’s good to hear! As you continue to grow personally, how do you think that will impact your relationship?
I think it’ll make us stronger. If I’m more confident, I can be a better partner.
Absolutely! Personal growth often leads to healthier relationships. Have you thought about any other personal goals you’d like to pursue?
I want to get a part-time job, maybe at a local shop, to gain more experience.
That sounds like a great plan! What steps can you take to start looking for opportunities?
I could check online job boards or ask around in my community.
That’s a proactive approach! Setting small, achievable goals can help you feel more in control. Is there anything else you’d like to explore today?
I guess just how to stay motivated while learning and looking for jobs.
Staying motivated can be challenging. Have you considered setting up a routine or schedule for your learning and job search?
I haven’t thought about that. A routine might help keep me on track.
It can definitely provide structure. How about we work together to outline a simple weekly plan for you?
Yeah, that sounds good!
Great! Let’s start by identifying how many hours you’d like to dedicate to learning and job searching each week.
Maybe about 10 hours for both?
That sounds reasonable. How would you like to break that down over the week?
I could do a couple of hours on weekdays and maybe a longer session on the weekend.
Perfect! That gives you a balanced approach. We can adjust it as needed. How do you feel about this plan?
I feel good about it! It feels manageable.
That’s wonderful! I’m excited to see how this works out for you. Let’s check in on your progress in our next session.
Sounds great! Thanks for the help!
You’re welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next time!
Bye!
